dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2018, security tokens were being hyped as the next big thing in crypto.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty eighteen, security tokens were being hyped as the next big thing in crypto.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many called it the next mega-trend in crypto.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I remember those conferences popping up everywhere, all focused on that one idea. But now, um, it's just not taking off like people thought.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I remember those conferences popping up everywhere, all focused on that one idea. But now, um, it's just not taking off like people thought.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Conferences sprung up entirely focused on security tokens. But fast-forward a year and a half, and progress has stalled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Polymath says over 100 have been created, but they're just not liquid. In the U.S., there are only two exchanges trading them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Polymath says over one hundred have been created, but they're just not liquid. In the U.S., there are only two exchanges trading them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 100 security tokens have been created, according to Polymath, a startup that helps companies mint coins. But theyre not liquid. In the U.S., just two exchanges exist where these assets trade, and volume is tiny.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And one of them, Openfinance, only trades four assets with less than a million dollars a day. That's tiny.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And one of them, Openfinance, only trades four assets with less than a million dollars a day. That's tiny.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Openfinance trades only four assets with daily transactions of less than $1 million a day, we estimate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A huge part of the problem is regulation. To even set up a trading venue here, you need to register as a broker-dealer with the SEC, which is a long and costly process.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A huge part of the problem is regulation. To even set up a trading venue here, you need to register as a broker-dealer with the S E C, which is a long and costly process.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For U.S. companies to build a trading venue for security tokens, they must register as a broker-dealer with the SEC and get a license for either an exchange or an alternative trading system (ATS), which requires a long and costly process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there are holding periods—like, after someone buys a new security, it can't change hands for a year. That really kills liquidity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there are holding periods-like, after someone buys a new security, it can't change hands for a year. That really kills liquidity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holding periods are also a delaying factor: After a brand new security is formed and purchased by an initial buyer, it typically cant change hands for a year due to regulations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Olga Feldmeier from Smart Valor had this vision of a global IPO where U.S. investors could easily invest in companies anywhere, but we're so far from that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Olga Feldmeier from Smart Valor had this vision of a global I P O where U.S. investors could easily invest in companies anywhere, but we're so far from that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In theory, security tokens could allow for a global IPO, says Olga Feldmeier, founder and CEO of Swiss security token exchange Smart Valor. Ideally with these tokens, U.S. investors could just as easily invest in a public company based in Mumbai as they could a New York company, which is far from the case today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because every country would need to agree on a common framework. Switzerland's already doing blockchain settlements, but here it's still controlled by the DTCC in New Jersey.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because every country would need to agree on a common framework. Switzerland's already doing blockchain settlements, but here it's still controlled by the D T C C in New Jersey.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But all participating nations would need to agree on a common framework. For example, in Switzerland, securities settlement can already happen on the blockchain, Feldmeier says. In the U.S., its controlled by the DTCC, a New Jersey clearinghouse that handles 90 million transactions daily.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it turns out just digitizing a security doesn't automatically create demand. Dovey Wan pointed out that real offerings should be led by firms with existing supply and channels.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it turns out just digitizing a security doesn't automatically create demand. Dovey Wan pointed out that real offerings should be led by firms with existing supply and channels.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dovey Wan, a crypto investor and cofounder of blockchain holding company Primitive Ventures, says, A real estate security token offering should be led by an existing real estate or REIT firm, where supply inventory can be guaranteed, and demand can come from existing channels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Harbor's CEO Josh Stein said yelling "token" isn't a substitute for good investment fundamentals. They actually had to cancel a $20 million offering because of financing issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Harbor's C E O Josh Stein said yelling token isn't a substitute for good investment fundamentals. They actually had to cancel a twenty dollars million offering because of financing issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: People have realized that yelling the word token is not a substitute for a good investment or distribution channels. In April, a $20 million security token offering led by Harbor was canceled after the participating real estate firm, Convexity Properties, couldnt get favorable terms on the loan it was using to finance the deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But some are still optimistic long-term. Polymath's building a new blockchain they say is more secure than Ethereum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But some are still optimistic long-term. Polymath's building a new blockchain they say is more secure than Ethereum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Polymath CEO Trevor Koverko believes his companys new blockchain will provide better security than Ethereumthe platform where most security tokens live todayand will boost adoption.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Fred Schebesta thinks faster settlement through shared ledgers could be a game-changer for banking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Fred Schebesta thinks faster settlement through shared ledgers could be a game-changer for banking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fred Schebesta, founder of Australian comparison site Finder and cofounder of crypto exchange HiveEx, says that faster settlement for banking transactions is the most important feature, since multiple parties can plug into the same shared ledger.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Short-term, though, Philippe Bekhazi from XBTO thinks we'll be in the same place a year from now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Short-term, though, Philippe Bekhazi from X B T O thinks we'll be in the same place a year from now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A year from now, well be in about the same place, said Philippe Bekhazi, CEO of crypto trading firm XBTO, at the Consensus conference last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Feldmeier even said it might take five to ten years to build the cross-border infrastructure needed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Feldmeier even said it might take five to ten years to build the cross-border infrastructure needed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Smart Valors Olga Feldmeier thinks it will take five to ten years to build the cross-jurisdictional infrastructure necessary for security tokens to trade across nearly every country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So if we're waiting on regulators… investors might be waiting a lot longer than they hoped.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So if we're waiting on regulators... investors might be waiting a lot longer than they hoped.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One thing is for sure: if adoption is contingent on regulators making a move, investors will be waiting longer than theyd like.
